{{< entity_summary >}}
The Government of Canada spent an estimated **\$634.0K in 2021-2022** on contracts with FISH FOOD AND ALLIED WORKERS.

Across 15 contracts active since the start of the 2017-2018 fiscal year, 5 have at least one amendment (33%). Of contracts with amendments, the average increase in dollar value was 261% and the average number of amendments was 1.6. Cumulatively these amendments represent an increase of \$158.5K over the original contract values.

The average contract duration was 1.21 years, and the average contract value (not including contracts under \$10k) was \$428.3K. The longest contract was 3.02 years. The largest contract by value (including amendments) was \$1.3M.

{{< /entity_summary >}}

- [FISH FOOD AND ALLIED WORKERS](https://search.open.canada.ca/en/ct/?sort=contract_value_f%20desc&page=1&search_text=%22FISH%20FOOD%20AND%20ALLIED%20WORKERS%22)
{{< /details >}}
